definitions.definition: the measurement of how tall a person or thing is

examples.text: Height: 210 mm. Width: 57 mm. Length: 170 mm.
Please state your height and weight.
She is the same height as her sister.
to be of medium/average height
It is almost two metres in height.
You can adjust the height of the chair.
The plant can **reach a height** of over six feet.
The table is available in several different heights.
The plants grow to a maximum height of 24 inches.
He is of medium height and slim build.

definitions.definition: the quality of being tall or high

examples.text: The height of the mountain did not discourage them.
His height sometimes makes it difficult to find clothes that fit.

definitions.definition: a particular distance above the ground
definitions.sensetop: at a height of somethingat… heightfrom a… height

examples.text: The aircraft was gaining height.
The plane flew at a height of 3 000 metres.
to be at shoulder/chest/waist height
The stone was dropped **from a great height**.
The object had clearly fallen from a considerable height.
The plane was beginning to lose height.
Bring your hands to shoulder height.
The balloon reached a height of 20 000 feet.
The animal lives in lakes at a height of 6 000 feet above sea level.

definitions.sensetop: from a heightfrom the heights of something

examples.text: Brooklyn Heights
He doesn't have **a head for heights** *(= is afraid of high places)*.
a fear of heights
The pattern of the ancient fields is clearly visible from a height.
We looked out over the city from the heights of Edinburgh Castle.
The condor soars above the mountain heights.
They were the first expedition to scale the heights of Everest.

definitions.definition: the point when something is at its strongest or best
definitions.sensetop: at its heightat the height of somethingin the height of somethingduring the height of something

examples.text: The fire **reached its height** around 2 a.m.
The crisis was at its height in May.
She is still at the **height of her powers**.
He is at the height of his career.
I wouldn't go there in the **height of summer**.
during the height of the Cold War

definitions.definition: a better or greater level of something; a situation where something is very good

examples.text: Their success had reached **new heights**.
He didn’t know it was possible to reach such heights of happiness.
She rose to undreamed-of heights of power and fame.

definitions.definition: an extreme example of a particular quality

examples.text: It would be **the height of folly** *(= very stupid)* to change course now.
She was dressed in **the height of fashion**.
She dreamed of reaching the dizzy heights of stardom.
They reached the dizzy heights of Number 11 in the charts.

definitions.definition: to stand straight and tall in order to show that you are determined, powerful or important

examples.text: He drew himself up to his full height and glared at us.

wordOrigin: Old English hēhthu (in the sense ‘top of something’), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hoogte, also to high.
